meanings.definition: Rolf - to laugh loudly and heartily
meanings.sent1: When the joke was told, everyone in the room rolfs with joy.
meanings.sent2: She rolfs at all the funny videos she watches online.
meanings.sent3: The baby rolfs uncontrollably at the silly faces her dad makes.
meanings.sent4: His infectious laughter rolfs through the entire office, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's hilarious performance made the audience rolfs until their sides hurt.

meanings.sent1: The sound of his rolfs echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: Her rolfs could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent3: The movie was so funny that it filled the theater with rolfs.
meanings.sent4: His rolfs were like music to her ears, always bringing a smile to her face.
meanings.sent5: The children's rolfs filled the playground with joy and happiness.

meanings.definition: Rolf - a person who laughs loudly and heartily
meanings.sent1: She is known as the rolfs of the group, always spreading laughter wherever she goes.
meanings.sent2: The rolfs of the party made everyone feel welcomed and happy.
meanings.sent3: The rolfs of the family always lightens up the mood during gatherings.
meanings.sent4: He is the rolfs of the office, making even the toughest days brighter with his laughter.
meanings.sent5: The rolfs of the classroom makes learning more enjoyable for everyone.
